laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial level was 8 g/dL (reference range, 12 to 16). 6 weeks earlier, level was 13 g/dL. One day before admission, level was 7 g/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased from 13 g/dL to 8 g/dL over 6 weeks and to 7 g/dL one day before admission.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Total bilirubin level was 1.1 mg/dL (reference range, 0 to 1.0 mg/dL); it had increased from a baseline level of 0.3 to 0.7 mg/dL.
Reticulocyte count was less than 0.5%, indicating a complete absence of bone marrow response.
Panreactive with increased reactivity compared to a prior test.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased reactivity observed on admission compared to two months before admission.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive test, confirming the presence of an autoantibody.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Remained positive on admission, consistent with previous findings where there was no concurrent anemia.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive at the time of admission and remained positive throughout the course.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Positive at admission and remained so throughout the patient's course.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: IgM and IgG Antibodies to Parvovirus B19
laboratory_examinations.findings: IgM level was 14.1 (reference range, <0.9); IgG level was 1.4 (reference range, <0.9).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: IgM decreased rapidly during the first month, becoming slightly detectable by the third month; IgG increased and plateaued.
